Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Interface IGameBoard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsGameBoard, GameBoard, GameBoardMem
    public interface IGameBoard
    Game Board is a numRow x numColumn string of characters. Initialization ensures: Game Board contains nothing, empty strings AND [size of gameBoard = numRow * numColumn] Defines: numRow: N - Total number of rows numColumn: N - Total number of columns numToWin: N - Total value of numbers to win Constraints: MIN_ROW <= self.row <= MAX_ROW MIN_COLUMN <= self.column <= MAX_COLUMN MIN_NUMTOWIN <= self.numToWin <= MAX_COLUMN

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfFree

        default boolean checkIfFree​(int c)
        This method checks if a column is full or not.
        Parameters:
        c - the column position of the game board
        Returns:
        true if the column can accept another token. false otherwise.
        Pre:
        0 <= c < MAX_COLUMN
        Post:
        Column = c AND game = #game AND checkTie iff game = [Blank spaces available]

      • placeToken

        void placeToken​(char p,
                int c)
        This method places the character p in column c. The token will be placed in the lowest available row in column c.
        Parameters:
        p - represents the character token that needs to be placed.
        c - the column position of the game board
        Pre:
        0 <= c < MAX_COLUMN AND [p is a valid character] AND checkFree(c) = true
        Post:
        Column = c AND game = #game AND [places token at c for player p]

      • checkForWin

        default boolean checkForWin​(int c)
        This method checks to see if a player has won the game.
        Parameters:
        c - number of columns
        Returns:
        True if the last token placed in the column resulted in a win, false otherwise.
        Pre:
        c > 0 [pos is the gameBoard position on the latest play]
        Post:
        Column = #c AND checkForWin iff [checkHorizWin equals true] OR [checkVertWin equals true] OR [checkDiagWin equals true] OR

      • checkTie

        default boolean checkTie()
        This method check to see if the game ended in a tie.
        Returns:
        True if the game is tied, false otherwise.
        Pre:
        [game is not won]
        Post:
        checkTie iff game = [No blank spaces available]

      • checkHorizWin

        default boolean checkHorizWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char p)
        This method checks to see if a player has won horizontally.
        Parameters:
        pos - The row and column position of the board.
        p - The X and O tokens.
        Returns:
        true if a player has won horizontally, false otherwise.
        Pre:
        0 <= lastPos.getRow() < MAX_ROW AND 0 <= lastPos.getcolumn() < MAX_COLUMN AND [p is valid] AND [lastPos was the location where the last marker was placed in] AND [pos is within valid bounds] AND [pos is a position on the latest play]
        Post:
        gameBoard = #gameBoard AND [finds whether player p won a horizontal victory at pos]

      • checkVertWin

        default boolean checkVertWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        This method checks to see if a player has won vertically.
        Parameters:
        pos - The row and column position of the board.
        p - The X and O tokens.
        Returns:
        true if a player has won vertically, false otherwise.
        Pre:
        pos > 0 AND [p is valid] AND 0 <= lastPos.getRow() < MAX_ROW AND 0 <= lastPos.getcolumn() < MAX_COLUMN AND [lastPos was the location where the last marker was place in] AND [pos is within valid bounds] AND [pos is a position on the latest play]
        Post:
        checkVertWin iff [p equals 5 matching characters consecutively in a column]

      • checkDiagWin

        default boolean checkDiagWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        This method checks to see if a player has won diagonally
        Parameters:
        pos - The row and column position of the board.
        p - The X and O tokens.
        Returns:
        true if a player has won diagonally, false otherwise.
        Pre:
        pos > 0 AND [p is valid] AND [pos is a position on the latest play] AND [pos is within valid bounds]
        Post:
        gameBoard = #gameBoard AND checkDiagWin iff [p matches 5 in a row going in a positive slope OR 5 in a row going in a negative slope]

      • whatsAtPos

        char whatsAtPos​(BoardPosition pos)
        This method the token ("", X, O) that is at the Row and Column position
        Parameters:
        pos - The row and column position of the board.
        Returns:
        the character that is at the current game board position.
        Pre:
        [pos is within valid bounds]
        Post:
        whatsAtPos = [character at pos (' ' or game token)] AND GameBoard = #GameBoard

      • isPlayerAtPos

        default boolean isPlayerAtPos​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char player)
        This method checks to see if a player is at a designated position.
        Parameters:
        pos - the row and column the player is currently at.
        player - represents the game X and O tokens.
        Returns:
        True if the player is at the desired position, false otherwise.
        Pre:
        [pos is within valid bounds] AND [player is valid]
        Post:
        isPlayerAtPos = [true if char at pos is player, false otherwise]

      • getNumRows

        int getNumRows()
        Returns:
        number of rows
        Post:
        getNumRows = [number to rows]

      • getNumColumns

        int getNumColumns()
        Returns:
        number of columns
        Post:
        getNumColumns = [number of columns]

      • getNumToWin

        int getNumToWin()
        Returns:
        number to win
        Post:
        getNumToWin = [number to win]
